#Text=Wikinews interviews evicted London Metropolitan University occupier
#Text=Tuesday , May 10 , 2011
#Text=Orion Building , hosting London Metropolitan University 's Graduate Centre .
#Text=Image : Alan Stanton .

#Text=A group of students at London Metropolitan University ( LMU ) who had been occupying the graduate centre at their university since the afternoon of Wednesday May 4 were evicted just before midnight on Monday by police , university security and private bailiffs .
#Text=Wikinews , in contact with the occupiers , obtained a first-hand interview with one of the occupiers less than two hours after the occupation ended .
#Text=The students staged the occupation in protest against cutbacks to courses at the university which , if enacted , would close 70 % of the courses the university offers .
#Text=John Hughes , 35 , a mature student born in the North London borough of Hackney and living in Brixton , was one of over twenty students who were sleeping overnight in the university building .
#Text=A second-year student in sociology and international development , one of the courses at risk , Hughes described the police intervention at around 11:40pm :
#Text=As I came in the area we were occupying they came straight in the door ...
#Text=There was no warning . [ ... ]
#Text=We were served the injunction on the spot by two county court sheriffs , four police officers , ten bailiffs and one member of London Met security .
#Text=We said , ' we need time to read this ' .
#Text=We were given ten minutes to read it and take our stuff .
#Text=London Met logo .
#Text=The occupiers have not had access to legal advice , although they have had " a bit of advice from some people who are not actually lawyers " .
#Text=The occupiers complain they were given no notice of the injunction and that it is inaccurate , naming at least one person " who had n't committed trespass at all " .

#Text=The eviction also pre-empts an agreement , negotiated by London Metropolitan University Students ' Union president Claire Locke , for LMU vice-chancellor Malcolm Gillies to meet with the occupation on Tuesday morning .

#Text=The occupiers feel certain now that Gillies ' office made this agreement with the Students ' Union and occupiers in bad faith , knowing that an injunction evicting the occupation would be served before then .
#Text=The injunction follows a night after the occupation was itself invaded by members of a private security firm hired by the university management .
#Text=In the early hours of Monday morning , occupiers say security staff kicked open the doors and entered an area where people were sleeping .
#Text=Security personnel say an alarm was going off in the area ; occupiers say there was no such alarm .
#Text=Private security have also been sexually harassing and verbally intimidating the occupiers , Hughes alleges .

#Text=" One of the members of the security team said through the doors to a young lady , ' you should put up a picture of yourself , something that 's more sexy ' and ' I 'm quite a big bloke , and if I wanted to come into the occupation I would .
#Text="

#Text=If the occupation had not been evicted , Hughes says they could have held out .

#Text= Students at Aberystwyth University in Wales occupied two rooms at their university for over a month earlier this year .
